How Big Data and Hadoop Training Programs Can Make a Big Difference

Nearly every professional can benefit from targeted analytics using big data and technologies like Hadoop. Use training programs to help your team understand and implement these innovations.

Annie Qureshi March 29, 2018 March 29, 2018
62 Shares 6,290 Views
  • Share on Facebook
  • Tweet on Twitter
  • +
Shutterstock Licensed Photo - By Wright Studio

Big Data generally describes large volumes of data. However, it is not the volume of the data that actually matters but the analytics that can be performed on that data to make better decisions and other business moves. Hadoop is another technology that has been developed for better handling and processing of big data. The demand for Hadoop developers is hiking at an increased pace due to its capability of performing analytics in a better way.

As Andre J writes: “Big data and analytics are all about detecting trends and gleaning insights in order to adapt to a changing business environment.” And luckily, you don’t have to remain in the dark before trying to implement big data and Hadoop strategies for whatever field you’re working in. Big Data and Hadoop online courses are out there to give you the proper training you and your team need with instructor-led 24-hour or 3-day course, hands-on practice and real-world simulations. Here, we flesh out who these courses are for and what they offer.

What are the objectives of Big Data and Hadoop courses?

The big data and Hadoop courses provide detailed knowledge about the big data framework with the use of Hadoop, Spark and other technologies. During the training, you would learn to execute real-life projects in the field of banking, telecommunication, e-commerce and several other fields which are booming at a rapid pace. In manufacturing, for example, big data and proper analytics greatly reduce downtime, mitigate supply chain risks and increase product quality. Big data can help marketing teams greatly increase productivity. And even non-profits can benefit from organizing big data to centralize their vendors and increase lead generation.

READ
Leveraging Big Data To Create An Extraordinary Explainer Video

What would you learn from this Big Data and Hadoop training program?

  • Understanding the working of big data and Hadoop along with learning its usability and benefits.
  • Learn and practice the best of the consideration for Hadoop development, algorithms, workflow implementation, and techniques for debugging.
  • Learn to use frameworks of Hadoop such as ApachePig, ApacheHive and several others from the Apache Hadoop Ecosystem.
  • Learning advanced Hadoop API and performing real-life analytics.
  • Learning about the hardware specifications which would help in maintaining the Hadoop cluster.

Who should all take up these Big Data and Hadoop training programs?

Opportunity in the big data career field is boosting at a great speed, and the Hadoop technology is also becoming a must-know for the same. Big Data and Hadoop training is a must for IT and data handling professionals. However, other professionals who can seek expertise in this program include:

  • Software developers
  • Analytics professionals
  • Data management professionals
  • Software testing professional

Along with the above-mentioned professionals, any graduates seeking a future in the big data analytics can take up the course and benefit from it.

READ
Here's How Big Data Is Transforming Online Gaming

What are the advantages of big data and Hadoop?

  • In this competitive world, the consumer also desires to get the best in the market. Each customer seeks special attention, and with big data, you can provide the customer with face-to -ace real-time interface.
  • Big data allows you to improve and develop your products as per the customer’s reviews and demands through social networking.
  • Big data can also be really helpful for the manufacturing industry. It allows you to test even the minor of the changes done to the product with computer aided design.
  • Big data provides you with a chance to be ahead of your competitors in the field through predictive analysis. Moreover, it reduces your chances to become a defaulter through regular analysis of the customers, suppliers and stakeholders.

Big Data and Hadoop courses are in great demand in the current world. Education on both of these innovations is absolutely essential to use them to create analytics that will help you make better business decisions – ultimately boosting your bottom line over time. Professionals in the IT, analytics, data management fields and many more can make use of this technology on several levels. If you wish to develop a bright future, this is the way to go.
